item.title: Land Area of Ancient Biblical Cities
item.description: City Land Size Notes Ephesus (Hellenistic period) 1km2 Hellenistic period Corinth 1km2 Jerusalem 1.5km2 Monaco 2km2 Today Gibralter 6.5km2 Today Rome (circa 70ad) 13km2 Circa 70ad. The largest City in The World

item.title: What is the Geographical Size of Jerusalem?
item.description: The estimated size of the city of Jerusalam (circa 30ad) is around is around 1.5km2. You could walk the length of Jerusalem in 10-15 mins. As a comparrison, Gilbralter has a 4 times larger geographical area (6.5km2) and it takes about 1 hour to walk itâ€™s length. This is a significant size difference from cities/towns of today. A medium sized city of today, for instance Manchester, would take around 4 hours to walk from one side to the other.
